# SMASH: Score Matching-based Pseudolikelihood Estimation of Neural Marked Spatio-Temporal Point Process
[![zread](https://img.shields.io/badge/Ask_Zread-_.svg?style=plastic&color=00b0aa&labelColor=000000&logo=data%3Aimage%2Fsvg%2Bxml%3Bbase64%%%%2BCjxwYXRoIGQ9Ik00IDEyTDEyIDQiIHN0cm9rZT0iI2ZmZiIgc3Ryb2tlLXdpZHRoPSIxLjUiIHN0cm9rZS1saW5lY2FwPSJyb3VuZCIvPgo8L3N2Zz4K&logoColor=ffffff)](https://zread.ai/zichongli5/SMASH)


This code is for SMASH main experiment on three marked STPP datasets: Earthquake, Crime and Football. Data files are included. The code is tested under a Linux desktop with torch 2.0 and Python 3.11.4.


## SMASH Environment
- Tested OS: Linux
- Python >= 3.7
- PyTorch == 2.0.1

## Data

Refer to `dataset/`, uploaded by Author Li. 

â˜† A little different from repo [DSTPP](https://github.com/tsinghua-fib-lab/Spatio-temporal-Diffusion-Point-Processes) (e.g. split of Earthquake is different, location of Crime in DSTPP is discrete (continuous in SMASH), Football wasn't used in DSTPP).

## Model Training

Use the following command to train and test SMASH on `Earthquake` dataset: 

``
cd ./scripts
bash train_earthquake.sh
``


## Note

- The implemention is based on one of the baselines: [DSTPP](https://github.com/tsinghua-fib-lab/Spatio-temporal-Diffusion-Point-Processes).

- [zread.ai: Technical Document](https://zread.ai/zichongli5/SMASH)
